alert.note: Alert for Glascock; Hancock; Jefferson; Putnam; Warren; Washington (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 15 at 6:50AM EDT until September 15 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Putnam County in central Georgia... Glascock County in east central Georgia... Central Hancock County in east central Georgia... Northern Jefferson County in east central Georgia... Southwestern Warren County in east central Georgia... North Central Washington County in east central Georgia... * Until 1245 PM EDT. * At 650 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sparta, Gibson, Wrens, Stapleton, Avera, Mitchell, Edge Hill, Edgehill, Shoals, Agricola, Hamburg State Park, Jewell, Beall Springs, Culverton, Bastonville, Stapletons Crossroads, Shoulderbone, Stellaville, Matthews and Rockville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Glascock; Hancock; Jefferson; Putnam; Warren; Washington
